_header: Sith the time that Christ Jesu
Note: For other texts see 4908 (Second version); 1557 (continuation of the story after Guy’s marriage); 6734.
_description: Guy of Warwick (First version) — 11,095 lines in couplets.

CamGon107.First Lines:
Syth the tyme þat cryst jhesuThorough hys grace &
                    vertu…
CamGon107.Last Lines:
…And on owres when we be dedeAnd graunt vs in hevyn to have a
                    sted
CamGon107.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius,

                MS.
             3 vols. 
             EETS
         e.s. 42 (1883); 49 (1887); 59 (1891); repr. as one vol., 1966.

BLSl1044.First Lines:
…[þei] þonkeþ god þat al haþ
                    wrouȝt[þ]at hym þider to hem haþ
                    brouȝt…
BLSl1044.Last Lines:
…And þe weder was myry and briȝtAnd Guy
                    þouȝt him anon riȝt…

NLS1921.First Lines:
…His lord he serued trewelicheIn al þing
                    manschipeliche…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…At Warwik þan henge þe heued anonMani [
                        erased ] man wondred þer apon
NLS1921.Note:
Probably began on stub, f. 107, so begins imperfectly; extends to line
                    7306 but imperfect through omissions.
